settings.sshKeys.page.title: SSH Keys
settings.sshKeys.page.description: Create and manage SSH Keys, you can use them to access your servers, git private repositories, and more.
settings.sshKeys.page.empty: You don't have any SSH keys
settings.sshKeys.delete.title: Delete SSH Key
settings.sshKeys.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this SSH Key?
settings.sshKeys.welcome.title: Choose how to add SSH Keys to your server:
settings.sshKeys.welcome.optionManual: Add SSH Key to Server Manually
settings.sshKeys.welcome.optionProvider: Add SSH Key when creating server in your provider
settings.sshKeys.welcome.manual.title: Manual Setup Instructions
settings.sshKeys.welcome.manual.step2: 2. When you are logged in run the following command
settings.sshKeys.welcome.manual.step3: 3. You're done, follow the next step to insert the details of your server.
settings.sshKeys.welcome.copyPublicKey: SSH public key copied to clipboard
settings.sshKeys.welcome.provider.title: Provider Setup Instructions
settings.sshKeys.welcome.provider.descri: Use this public key when creating a server in your preferred provider (Hostinger, Digital Ocean, Hetzner, etc.)
settings.notifications.page.title: Notifications
settings.notifications.page.description: Add your providers to receive notifications, like Discord, Slack, Telegram, Email, Lark.
settings.notifications.page.empty: To send notifications it is required to set at least 1 provider.
settings.notifications.delete.title: Delete Notification
settings.notifications.delete.descriptio: Are you sure you want to delete this notification?
settings.notifications.form.updateDescri: Update your notification providers for multiple channels.
settings.notifications.form.addDescripti: Create new notification providers for multiple channels.
settings.notifications.form.name.label: Name
settings.notifications.telegram.messageT: Optional. Use it when you want to send notifications to a specific topic in a group.
settings.notifications.ntfy.topic.label: Topic
Optional. Leave blank for public topics.
settings.notifications.actions.title: Select the actions.
settings.notifications.actions.appDeploy: Trigger the action when an app is deployed.
settings.notifications.actions.appBuildE: Trigger the action when the build fails.
settings.notifications.actions.databaseB: Trigger the action when a database backup is created.
settings.notifications.actions.dockerCle: Trigger the action when the Docker cleanup is performed.
settings.notifications.actions.dokployRe: Trigger the action when Dokploy is restarted.
settings.notifications.actions.serverThr: Trigger the action when the server threshold is reached.
At least one email is required
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.title: Gitea Provider
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.descript: To integrate your Gitea account, create a new OAuth2 application in your Gitea settings and paste its credentials below.
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.steps.na: Navigate to Applications -> Create new OAuth2 Application
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.steps.cr: Create a new application with the following details:
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.steps.af: After creating the application, copy the Client ID and Client Secret and paste them below.
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.redirect: This will be used as the callback URL
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.toast.no: Failed to get Gitea ID from response
settings.gitProviders.gitea.add.toast.in: Please fill in Client ID and Gitea URL first.
settings.gitProviders.gitea.edit.title: Edit Gitea Provider
settings.gitProviders.gitea.edit.toast.c: Your Gitea provider has been authorized.
settings.gitProviders.gitea.edit.toast.n: Please complete the OAuth authorization process.
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.title: GitLab Provider
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.descrip: To integrate your GitLab account, create a new application in your GitLab settings and paste its credentials below.
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.steps.g: Go to your GitLab profile settings
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.steps.c: Create a new application with the following details:
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.steps.a: After creating the application, copy the Application ID and Secret and paste them below.
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.redirec: This will be used as the callback URL
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.add.groupNa: For organization/group access use the slugish name of the group e.g. my-org
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.edit.title: Update GitLab
settings.gitProviders.gitlab.edit.groupN: For organization/group access use the slugish name of the group e.g. my-org
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.add.desc: To integrate your Bitbucket account, create an API token and configure the provider using the form below.
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.add.warn: Bitbucket App Passwords are deprecated for new providers. Use an API Token instead. Existing providers with App Passwords will continue to work until 9th June 2026.
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.add.guid: Click on Create API token with scopes.
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.add.name: Name
Your Bitbucket Provider, e.g. my-personal-account
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.edit.des: Update your Bitbucket authentication. Use an API Token for enhanced security (recommended) or an App Password for legacy support.
settings.gitProviders.bitbucket.edit.app: App Password (legacy - will be deprecated June 2026)
settings.gitProviders.github.add.title: GitHub Provider
settings.gitProviders.github.add.descrip: To integrate your GitHub account with our services, you'll need to create and install a GitHub app. This process is straightforward and only takes a few minutes. Click the button below to get started.
settings.gitProviders.github.add.install: Unsure if you already have an app?
settings.gitProviders.github.edit.title: Update GitHub
settings.git.page.title: Git Providers
settings.git.page.description: Connect your Git provider for authentication.
settings.git.delete.title: Delete Git Provider
settings.git.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this Git Provider?
settings.destinations.page.title: S3 Destinations
settings.destinations.page.description: Add your providers like AWS S3, Cloudflare R2, Wasabi, DigitalOcean Spaces etc.
settings.destinations.page.empty: To create a backup it is required to set at least 1 provider.
settings.destinations.delete.title: Delete Destination
settings.destinations.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this destination?
settings.destinations.dialog.description: Configure and add new destinations for your backups. Please ensure the information is correct to guarantee secure and efficient storage.
settings.destinations.form.name.label: Name
settings.destinations.form.bucket.label: Bucket
settings.destinations.form.region.label: Region
settings.destinations.form.server.label: Server (Optional)
settings.destinations.test.cloudHelp: Select a server to test the destination. If you don't have a server, choose the default one.
settings.registry.page.title: Docker Registry
settings.registry.page.empty: You don't have any registry configurations
settings.registry.delete.title: Delete Registry
settings.registry.delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete this registry configuration?
settings.servers.page.title: Servers
settings.servers.page.description: Add servers to deploy your applications remotely.
settings.servers.page.emptyNoSSHKeys: No SSH Keys found. Add a SSH Key to start adding servers.
settings.servers.page.emptyNoServers: Start adding servers to deploy your applications remotely.
settings.servers.onboarding.title: Welcome to Dokploy Cloud ðŸŽ‰
settings.servers.onboarding.description: Thank you for choosing Dokploy Cloud! ðŸš€ We're excited to have you onboard. Before you dive in, you'll need to configure your remote server to unlock all the features we offer.
settings.servers.onboarding.requisites.i: Before getting started, please follow the steps below to ensure the best experience:
settings.servers.onboarding.complete.sub: Did you know you can deploy any number of applications that your server can handle?
Here are some of the things you can do with Dokploy Cloud:
settings.servers.onboarding.features.sca: Deploy and scale your applications effortlessly to handle any workload.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.aut: Protect your data with automatic backups.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.ope: Big list of common open source templates in one-click.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.cus: Link your own domains to your applications for a professional presence.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.ciC: Implement continuous integration and deployment workflows to streamline development.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.dat: Efficiently manage your databases with intuitive tools.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.tea: Collaborate with your team on shared projects with customizable permissions.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.mul: Deploy applications in multiple programming languages to suit your needs.
settings.servers.onboarding.features.api: Integrate and manage your applications via robust and well-documented APIs.
settings.servers.onboarding.help.title: Need Help? We are here to help you.
settings.servers.onboarding.help.subtitl: Join our Discord server and we will help you.
settings.servers.onboarding.setup.select: Select the server and click on setup server
settings.servers.onboarding.setup.cardDe: To setup a server, please click on the button below.
settings.servers.onboarding.setup.helper: When your server is ready, you can click on the button below to directly run the script we use to setup the server, or modify the script first.
settings.servers.onboarding.setup.dialog: This will setup the server and all associated data.
settings.servers.onboarding.verify.cardD: Check if your server is ready for deployment.
settings.servers.onboarding.verify.statu: Shows the build server configuration status.
settings.servers.table.caption: See all servers
settings.servers.table.name: Name
settings.servers.delete.title: Delete Server
settings.servers.delete.description: This will delete the server and all associated data
settings.servers.delete.blockedDescripti: You can not delete this server because it has active services.
settings.servers.delete.blockedAlert: You have active services associated with this server, please delete them first.
settings.servers.setup.noSshKeyWarning: Please add an SSH Key to this server before running the setup. You can assign an SSH Key in the Edit Server dialog.
settings.servers.setup.rootUserWarning: Using a root user is required to ensure everything works as expected.
We strongly recommend using one of the following distributions to ensure the best experience:
settings.servers.gpu.card.title: GPU Configuration
settings.servers.gpu.dialog.enable.title: Enable GPU Support?
settings.servers.gpu.dialog.enable.descr: This will enable GPU support for Docker Swarm on this server. Make sure you have the required hardware and drivers installed.
settings.servers.gpu.requirements.title: System Requirements:
settings.servers.gpu.requirements.hardwa: An NVIDIA GPU must be physically installed.
settings.servers.gpu.requirements.driver: NVIDIA drivers must be installed and running (check with nvidia-smi).
settings.servers.gpu.requirements.runtim: NVIDIA Container Runtime (nvidia-container-runtime) must be installed.
settings.servers.gpu.requirements.cudaSu: System must support CUDA for GPU acceleration.
settings.servers.gpu.section.prerequisit: Shows all software checks and available hardware.
settings.servers.gpu.status.driver.label: NVIDIA Driver
settings.servers.gpu.status.memory.label: GPU Memory
settings.servers.gpu.status.cuda.label: CUDA Support
settings.servers.gpu.section.swarmStatus: Shows the configuration state that changes when GPU support is enabled.
settings.servers.gpu.toast.enableError: Failed to enable GPU support. Please check server logs.
settings.servers.gpu.modal.title: Dokploy Server GPU Setup
settings.servers.script.dialog.title: Modify Script
settings.servers.script.dialog.descripti: Modify the script that installs everything necessary to deploy applications on your server.
settings.servers.script.alert.warning: We recommend not modifying this script unless you know what you are doing.
settings.servers.dockerCleanup.label: Daily Docker Cleanup
settings.servers.terminal.title: Terminal ({{name}})
settings.servers.terminal.description: Easy way to access the server
settings.servers.security.card.title: Security Recommendations
settings.servers.security.card.descripti: Check the security recommendations for your server.
settings.servers.security.alert.experime: Security checks are currently supported for Ubuntu/Debian-based OS (Experimental).
settings.servers.security.ufw.title: UFW
settings.servers.security.ufw.descriptio: UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) is a simple firewall that can be used to block incoming and outgoing traffic from your server.
Not Installed (UFW should be installed for security)
settings.servers.security.ufw.status.ina: Not Active (UFW should be enabled for security)
settings.servers.security.ufw.defaultInc: Default: {{policy}} (Should be set to 'deny' for security)
settings.servers.security.ssh.title: SSH
settings.servers.security.ssh.descriptio: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol that allows you to securely connect to a server and execute commands on it.
settings.servers.security.ssh.keyAuth.di: Not Enabled (Key Authentication should be enabled)
settings.servers.security.ssh.usePam.ena: Enabled (Should be disabled when using key-based auth)
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.title: Fail2Ban
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.descr: Fail2Ban is a service that can be used to prevent brute force attacks on your server.
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.insta: Not Installed (Fail2Ban should be installed for protection against brute force attacks)
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.enabl: Not Enabled (Fail2Ban service should be enabled)
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.activ: Not Active (Fail2Ban service should be running)
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.sshPr: Not Enabled (SSH protection should be enabled to prevent brute force attacks)
settings.servers.security.fail2ban.sshMo: Mode: {{mode}} (Aggressive mode recommended for better protection)
